column2: NORTH DAKOTA DMV TEST
Question Text
1. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
2. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column6: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.

column2: 3. _____________ lights indicate that drivers should slow down and proceed with caution at an intersection.
4. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column6: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 5. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
6. __________________ give you right-of-way to make a left turn.
7. __________ are blue with white letters and symbols.
8. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: Drive with caution and be ready to stop

column2: 9. Drivers should always signal when:
column6: pulling into traffic from a parking area or alley.
column8: pulling out of a parking space.

column2: 10. You are stopped behind other vehicles waiting at a stop sign. When the intersection is clear:
column4: you may follow the vehicle ahead without stopping again.
column6: you must stop again at the stop sign.
column8: you may proceed with caution through the intersection without stopping if there is no other traffic.
column10: you must proceed through the intersection without stopping again.

column2: 11. Drivers should use the horn:
column4: only when necessary, to avoid collisions.
column6: to alert other drivers that they made a mistake.
column10: if a driver is moving slowly, and you want them to drive faster.

column2: 12. Roads are most slippery:
column10: when it first starts to rain.

column2: 13. This is the shape and color of a ________ sign.
14. In the following situations, drivers should increase their following interval:
column6: When it is hard to see ahead because of bad weather.
column8: When following vehicles that are required to come to a stop at railroad crossings.

column2: 15. If an aggressive driver cuts you off, you should:
column4: look towards the left side of the road.
column10: stay calm and get out of the aggressive driver's way.

column2: 16. You must pull over to the edge of the road and allow an emergency vehicle to pass:
column4: only if the emergency vehicle is approaching.
column8: only if the emergency vehicle is following you.

column2: 17. This sign means:
column10: You must yield the right-of-way ahead

column2: 18. When you see an emergency vehicle with flashing lights, you must:
column6: drive to the right side of the road and stop.
column8: stay in your lane, slow down, and let it pass.
column10: keep moving slowly, staying to the right side of the road.

column2: 19. What does the flashing signal in the picture indicate?
column4: The same thing as a stop sign.
column6: Pedestrians should finish crossing the street if started.
column10: Pedestrians should start crossing the street.

column2: 20. Large trucks:
column6: can stop quicker than passenger vehicles.
column8: do not need more room to maneuver.

column2: 21. At night, it is hardest to see:
22. What type of pavement marking shows you which lane you must use for a turn?
23. To practice defensive driving you should:
column4: look well ahead of your vehicle and be aware of developing traffic situations around you.
column8: always leave yourself a way out.

column2: 24. A flashing red traffic light:
column4: indicates that you should drive with caution.
column6: has the same meaning as a stop sign.
column8: has the same meaning as a yield sign.
column10: is used to indicate a pedestrian crossing.

column2: 25. This sign means:
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
